channel.title: R on Ajinkya Shinde
channel.description: Recent content in R on Ajinkya Shinde

item.title: Take A Sad Plot And Make It Better 2.0 - Graph 1
item.description: 1. Relevant R-code meanGDP_country <- gapminder %>% group_by(country,continent) %>% summarize(meanGdp=mean(gdpPercap)) ggplot(meanGDP_country,aes(x=meanGdp)) + geom_histogram(binwidth=500,fill="white", color="black") + coord_cartesian(xlim=c(0,30000))+ facet_wrap(~continent)+ xlab("Mean GDP across countries within continent") 2. Description of the Type of Graph This is a histogram used to measure the spread of GDP across countries within each continent 3. Description of the DATA used glimpse(meanGDP_country) ## Observations: 142 ## Variables: 3 ## $ country <fct> Afghanistan, Albania, Algeria, Angola, Argentina, Au.

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.
